page.title: 12THE SEVERN BORE
page.content: The event which brings most outsiders to Minsterworth is the Severn Bore. The Bore is a small tidal wave which travels up the River Severn. It is caused by a high tide in the Severn Estuary: as the water is drawn up the estuary into the narrowing river, the water forms into a tidal wave which can be as much as 6 feet high. The bore travels upriver at about 10 mph. Although the bore can travel past Gloucester as far as Tewkesbury, the best places to see it are below Gloucester, especially at Minsterworth where there is a footpath alongside the river. If there is a big bore during the day at a weekend, then there is often a large crowd to watch it. It can be difficult to find anywhere to park a car!
